The release was followed by an extensive tour throughout the United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and parts of Europe, including [[Primavera Sound Festival]] in [[Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit redo f\u00f6r stora genomslaget|date=28 December 2011 |url=http://www.helagotland.se/noje/first-aid-kit-redo-for-stora-genomslaget-7370083.aspx|publisher=Helagotland.se|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit ready to save America this fall|date=25 July 2010 |url=https://consequence.net/2010/07/first-aid-kit-ready-to-save-america-this-fall/|publisher=Consequence|access-date=1 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit Sunday 05 September - Saturday 11 September 2010|url=http://www.pennydrop.com.au/tour/first-aid-kit-5/|publisher=pennydrop.com.au|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206204224/http://www.pennydrop.com.au/tour/first-aid-kit-5/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit September 16, 2010 The Wine Cellar, Auckland|url=http://www.einsteinmusicjournal.co.nz/first-aid-kit-live-photos/|publisher=einsteinmusicjournal.co.nz|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=San Miguel Primavera Sound 2010 Tickets|url=http://www.primaverasound.es/noticiaSingle?id=238/|publisher=primaverasound.es|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>\n\nOn 19 November 2009, Klara and Johanna met [[Conor Oberst]] after [[Monsters of Folk]]'s concert in Stockholm, and gave him a demo of their coming album.<ref>{{cite web|title=\"Vi \u00e4r inblandade i allt tillsammans\", 28 December 2011|date=28 December 2011 |url=https://www.expressen.se/noje/vi-ar-inblandade-i-allt-tillsammans/|publisher=expressen.se|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> Oberst watched the duo perform at the [[Austin City Limits Music Festival]] pre-party in Texas on 7 October 2010. At this concert, he was especially impressed by the duo's acoustic performance of Ghost Town, which the audience listened to in rapt silence. After meeting the duo, Oberst called [[Mike Mogis]] and asked him to see the duo's performance at the ACL Festival two days later, on October 9.<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" /> After watching this performance, Mogis offered to produce the duo's next album.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=29:20\u201331:20}}<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.svd.se/allt-stammer-for-first-aid-kit|title=Allt stammer f\u00f6r First Aid Kit|date=27 January 2012|publisher=svd.se|access-date=7 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160312104906/http://www.svd.se/allt-stammer-for-first-aid-kit|archive-date=12 March 2016}}</ref>\n\nTwo days later, on 11 October 2010, after playing a concert in [[Nashville]], the duo received a telephone call from [[Jack White (musician)|Jack White]], who asked the duo to visit his studio the next day.<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" /> The result was a vinyl single containing cover versions of [[Buffy Sainte-Marie]]'s \"[[Universal Soldier (song)|Universal Soldier]]\" and [[Mel London]]'s and [[Tampa Red]]'s \"[[It Hurts Me Too]]\". The single was released on White's [[Third Man Records]] label.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=35:30\u201336:55}}<ref>{{cite web|title=14 May 2014 First Aid Kit at Jo Whiley BBC Radio 2, (at 2:30 of the interview)|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p01z4wq7/|publisher=Bbc.co.uk|access-date=25 May 2014}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit performed at the [[Polar Music Prize]] gala on 30 August 2011 in Stockholm, where they performed the song \"[[Dancing Barefoot]]\" for the winner [[Patti Smith]]. Smith was moved to tears at the intense ending of the song.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=4:03\u20136:40}}\n\nJohanna, under the moniker ''MoA'', released song covers of K-Pop artists such as [[2NE1]] and [[4Minute]]<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-07-20 |title=The Swedish Composer Behind HyunA's New Single \"Nabillera\" Actually Has A Surprising (Now Deleted) History With The K-Pop World |url=https://www.koreaboo.com/stories/composer-hyuna-new-nabillera-surprising-kpop-world/ |access-date=2023-02-22 |website=Koreaboo |language=en-US}}</ref> during 2010 to 2011. The covers were deleted after her identity was inadvertently revealed.\n\n===2012\u20132013: ''The Lion's Roar''===\n[[File:First Aid Kit (Frankfurt am Main, 18.02.2012).jpg|thumb|left|First Aid Kit (Frankfurt am Main, 18 February 2012)]]\nIn January 2012, the band released their second album, ''[[The Lion's Roar (album)|The Lion's Roar]]'', produced by [[Mike Mogis]]. The album was critically acclaimed, debuting at number one in Sweden and number 35 in the UK. The duo toured extensively in support of the album, including performances at several major festivals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2517105/lollapalooza-2012-friday/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206203450/http://www.mtv.com/news/2517105/lollapalooza-2012-friday/|url-status=dead|archive-date=6 December 2017|title=First Aid Kit talks festival essentials and more at Lollapalooza 2012|date=4 August 2012|publisher=mtv.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://diymag.com/archive/bestival-2012-first-aid-kit|title=Bestival 2012: First Aid Kit|date=12 September 2012|publisher=diymag.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.clashmusic.com/live/berlin-festival-2012|title=Berlin Festival 2012|date=19 September 2012|publisher=clashmusic.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.austinchronicle.com/music/2012-10-19/acl-live-shot-first-aid-kit/|title=ACL Live Shot: First Aid Kit|date=19 October 2012|publisher=austinchronicle.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> The duo performed the song \"Emmylou\" on ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' in April 2012,<ref>{{Cite web|date=17 April 2012|title=Watch First Aid Kit Play \"Emmylou\" On Conan|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2012/04/watch-first-aid-kit-play-emmylou-on-conan.html|access-date=6 December 2017|publisher=pastemagazine.com|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206213953/https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2012/04/watch-first-aid-kit-play-emmylou-on-conan.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> and on [[Late Show with David Letterman|''The Late Show with David Letterman'']] in October 2012.<ref>{{cite web|title=IMDb|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3323384/|access-date=18 January 2014|publisher=IMDb.com}}</ref> \n\nOn 28 August 2012, they performed \"[[America (Simon & Garfunkel song)|America]]\" for the Polar Music Prize winner [[Paul Simon]], who gave the duo a standing ovation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://time.com/3591929/first-aid-kit-america-video/|title=Watch First Aid Kit Travel the Country in 'America' Video|date=18 November 2014|publisher=time.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>\n\n[[File:First Aid Kit p\u00e5 Grammisgalan 2013.jpg|thumb|upright=.8|Johanna and Klara S\u00f6derberg at the [[Grammis|Swedish Grammis Awards]] in 2013]]\n\nThe song \"The Lion's Roar\" was featured in episode 2 of series 4 of ''[[Misfits (TV series)|Misfits]]'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.misfitsmusic.co.uk/php/season4/misfits_season4_episode_2.php|title=Misfits Series 4: Episode 2 Playlist|publisher=misfitsmusic.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=1 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201114455/http://www.misfitsmusic.co.uk/php/season4/misfits_season4_episode_2.php|url-status=dead}}</ref> and in the opening sequence of the video game \"[[The Long Dark]]\". \"In the Hearts of Men\" was featured in episode 21 of season 8 of ''[[Bones (TV series)|Bones]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.tunefind.com/show/bones/season-8/14102|title=Bones S8, E21 The Maiden in the Mushrooms|publisher=tunefind.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> The song \"I Found a Way\" appeared in the second episode of the [[Dontnod Entertainment]]'s 2019 video game ''[[Life Is Strange 2]]'' in 2019.\n\nIn November 2012, the duo received awards for \"Composer of the year\" and \"Breakthrough of the Year\" from the Swedish Music Publishers Association.<ref>{{cite web|title=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarnas pris - Resultat & bilder 2012|url=http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2012|publisher=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarna|access-date=12 November 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218025532/http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2012|archive-date=18 December 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> The song \"Emmylou\" was listed at 10th position by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine in their \"Single of the Year\" list of 2012.<ref name=\"Emmylou_RollingStone\"/> In February 2013, First Aid Kit was awarded the [[Nordic Music Prize]] for Best Nordic 2012 Album.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit wins the third annual Nordic Music Prize! (archived) |url=http://nordicmusicprize.com/ |publisher=Nordicmusicprize.com |access-date=12 May 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140518112144/http://nordicmusicprize.com/ |archive-date=18 May 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=S\u00f8strene vant nordisk albumpris|url=http://www.aftenposten.no/incoming/Sostrene-vant-nordisk-albumpris-7121987.html|publisher=Aftenposten.no|access-date=15 February 2013}}</ref> They were also awarded four Swedish [[Grammis]] awards for 2012 \"Artist of the Year\", \"Songwriter of the Year\", \"Best Pop of the Year\" and \"Album of the Year\".<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit Win 4 Grammis! |url=http://www.wichita-recordings.com/news/first-aid-kit-win-4-grammis |access-date=4 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201133837/http://www.wichita-recordings.com/news/first-aid-kit-win-4-grammis |archive-date=1 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Grammisvinnarna genom \u00e5ren|url=http://grammis.se/om-grammis/grammisvinnarna-genom-aren/|publisher=Grammis.se|access-date=22 September 2017}}</ref>\n\n===2014\u20132016: ''Stay Gold''===\n[[File:First Aid Kit - Ruisrock 2014-07-06.jpg|thumb|left|First Aid Kit at [[Ruisrock]] 6 July 2014]]\n\nTheir third studio album, ''[[Stay Gold (First Aid Kit album)|Stay Gold]]'', was released on 10 June 2014 through [[Columbia Records]].<ref>{{cite tweet|user=ColumbiaRecords|author=Columbia Records|number=450643939285286912|date=31 March 2014|title=.@FirstAidKitBand's \"Stay Gold\" hits stores June 10th. Pre-order now & get an instant download of \"My Silver Lining\"}}</ref> The band released two singles from the album: \"[[My Silver Lining (First Aid Kit song)|My Silver Lining]]\" and \"Cedar Lane\".<ref>{{cite web|title=My Silver Lining Single|url=http://www.indieshuffle.com/first-aid-kit-my-silver-lining/|publisher=Indieshuffle.com|access-date=31 March 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.scandipop.co.uk/first-aid-kit-cedar-lane/|title=First Aid Kit: 'Cedar Lane'|date=6 May 2014|publisher=scandipop.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> As a result, the duo again received the \"Composer of the year\" prize from the Swedish Music Publishers Association.<ref>{{cite web|title=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarnas pris - Resultat & bilder 2014|url=http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2014|publisher=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarna|access-date=12 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160311085652/http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2014|archive-date=11 March 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref> In January 2015, First Aid Kit was nominated for the [[2015 Brit Awards]] in the Best International Group category as one of five nominees,<ref name=\"Brit2015\" /> and won the \"Best group of the year\" prize in the [[Sveriges Radio P3|Swedish Radio P3]] Gold Gala.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://sverigesradio.se/sida/gruppsida.aspx?programid=3964&grupp=21828&artikel=6070322/|title= \u00c5rets grupp: First Aid Kit|date=17 January 2015|language=sv|access-date=18 January 2015}}</ref> In the same month, the band was featured on a Swedish postage stamp.<ref>{{cite web|title=Swedish pop exports on postage stamps|url=http://www.postnord.com/en/media/press-releases/postnord/2014/swedish-pop-exports-avicii-and-robyn-on-postage-stamps/|publisher=Postnord|access-date=9 November 2014|archive-date=8 November 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141108214122/http://www.postnord.com/en/media/press-releases/postnord/2014/swedish-pop-exports-avicii-and-robyn-on-postage-stamps|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album ''Stay Gold'' was listed at number 6 in the [[Paste (magazine)|Paste magazine]]'s 40 best folk albums of the 2010s list.<ref>{{cite web|date=22 November 2019|title=The 40 Best Folk Albums of the 2010s|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2019/11/best-folk-albums-of-the-2010s.html|access-date=24 November 2019|work=pastemagazine.com}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit began touring again in May 2014, visiting North America, Europe, Japan and Australia.<ref>Multiple sources:\n*{{cite web|title=Sony Press Release 25 February 2014: Swedish Duo First Aid Kit Unveils North American Spring Tour|url=https://www.sony.com/en_us/SCA/company-news/press-releases/sony-columbia-records/2014/swedish-duo-first-aid-kit-unveils-north-american-s.html|publisher=Sony.com|access-date=6 March 2014|archive-date=24 September 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924001412/http://www.sony.com/en_us/SCA/company-news/press-releases/sony-columbia-records/2014/swedish-duo-first-aid-kit-unveils-north-american-s.html|url-status=dead}}\n*{{Cite web|url=http://www.supajam.com/review/show/Ryan-Adams-and-First-Aid-Kit-at-iTunes-Festival|title=Live Review: Ryan Adams and First Aid Kit at iTunes Festival|date=22 September 2014|publisher=supajam.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}\n*{{Cite web|url=https://consequence.net/2014/09/live-review-first-aid-kit-at-londons-royal-albert-hall-924/|title=Live Review: First Aid Kit at London's Royal Albert Hall (9/24)|date=26 September 2014|publisher=Consequence|access-date=2 February 2022}}\n*{{cite web|title=Swedish folk duo returns to the U.S. for biggest-ever fall headline tour|url=http://360magazine.tumblr.com/post/95214697738/first-aid-kit-set-to-perform-at-itunes-festival-in|publisher=the360mag.com|access-date=20 August 2014}}\n*{{Cite web|url=http://diymag.com/2015/01/14/first-aid-kit-release-crafty-new-video-for-master-pretender|title=First Aid Kit release crafty new video for Master Pretender|date=14 January 2015|publisher=diymag.com|access-date=7 December 2017}}\n*{{Cite web|url=http://gaffa.se/nyhet/89014/first-aid-kit-pa-sverigeturne|title=First Aid Kit p\u00e5 Sverigeturn\u00e9|date=24 October 2014|publisher=gaffa.se|access-date=7 December 2017|archive-date=8 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171208003401/http://gaffa.se/nyhet/89014/first-aid-kit-pa-sverigeturne|url-status=dead}}\n*{{Cite web|url=http://www.theaureview.com/news/luluc-confirmed-as-national-supports-for-first-aid-kits-2015-australian-tour|title=Luluc confirmed as national supports for First Aid Kits 2015 Australian tour|date=7 December 2014|publisher=theaureview.com|access-date=7 December 2017|archive-date=8 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171208003906/http://www.theaureview.com/news/luluc-confirmed-as-national-supports-for-first-aid-kits-2015-australian-tour|url-status=dead}}\n*{{cite web|title=Dad Rock deluxe interview with First Aid Kit|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2015/07/31/dad-rock-deluxe-interview-first-aid-kit/30956051/|publisher=usatoday.com|access-date=29 August 2015}}</ref> The final performance was on 15 August 2015, at [[Way Out West (festival)|Way Out West Festival]] in Gothenburg, Sweden.<ref>{{cite news|url = http://www.svd.se/first-aid-kit-stangde-way-out-west|title= First Aid Kit st\u00e4ngde Way Out West|newspaper= Svenska Dagbladet|date= 15 August 2015|language=sv|publisher=svd.se|access-date=29 August 2015}}</ref> Except for two Christmas concerts with [[Seinabo Sey]], [[Amanda Bergman]] and Maja Francis on 13 December 2015 in Stockholm,<ref>{{cite news|url = http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/konsertrecensioner/first-aid-kit-seinabo-sey-amanda-bergman-och-maja-francis-pa-fargfabriken-stockholm/|title= First Aid Kit, Seinabo Sey, Amanda Bergman och Maja Francis p\u00e5 F\u00e4rgfabriken, Stockholm|language=sv|newspaper=Dagens Nyheter|date= 15 December 2015|access-date=23 December 2015}}</ref> the duo performed no concerts again until summer 2017, as they needed a break in order to prepare the new record.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uyyYcMWrPf4|title= GRAMMY Pro Buzzin' With First Aid Kit At Lollapalooza (interview video)|date= 20 August 2015|publisher=Recording Academy|access-date=28 June 2018}}</ref>{{rp|at=8:30\u20138:50}}\n\n[[File:First Aid Kit at Royal Albert Hall, London, UK Sept 24, 2014.jpg|thumb|First Aid Kit accompanied by Stockholm Strings at [[Royal Albert Hall]], London on 24 September 2014]]\nDuring 2014-2016 they performed twice on ''The Late Show with David Letterman''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sony Music Canada 14 May 2014: First Aid Kit performing song on Letterman June 12|url=https://plus.google.com/+sonymusiccanada/posts/14aiDppBXKx|access-date=27 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.stereogum.com/1800274/watch-first-aid-kits-spine-tingling-cover-of-simon-garfunkels-america-on-letterman/video/|title=Watch First Aid Kit's Spine-Tingling Cover Of Simon & Garfunkel's \"America\" On Letterman|date=8 May 2015|publisher=stereogum.com|access-date=7 December 2017}}</ref> and on ''[[Later... with Jools Holland]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p0277z89|title=First Aid Kit perform My Silver Lining on Later... with Jools Holland|date=23 September 2014|publisher=bbc.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b04jtzj1|title=Later... with Jools Holland Series 45 Episode 2 of 8|date=27 September 2014|publisher=bbc.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> They also appeared on ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2014/11/first-aid-kit-perform-stay-gold-on-conan.html|title=First Aid Kit Perform \"Stay Gold\" on Conan|date=12 November 2014|publisher=pastemagazine.com|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=7 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171207014725/https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2014/11/first-aid-kit-perform-stay-gold-on-conan.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://diffuser.fm/first-aid-kit-my-silver-lining-ellen-video/|title=Watch First Aid Kit Perform 'My Silver Lining' on Ellen|date=9 December 2014|publisher=diffuser.fm|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> ''[[The Graham Norton Show]]''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b051c7m2|title=The Graham Norton Show, Episode 16 Series 16|date=4 February 2015|publisher=bbc.co.uk|access-date=7 December 2017}}</ref> and ''[[CBS This Morning]]'' TV show.<ref>{{cite web|title=Watch First Aid Kit Perform Three 'Stay Gold' Songs on CBS This Morning|date=8 August 2015 |url=http://diffuser.fm/watch-first-aid-kit-perform-three-stay-gold-songs-on-cbs-this-morning/|publisher=diffuser.fm/|access-date=29 August 2015}}</ref> On 9 June 2015, they performed \"[[Red Dirt Girl]]\" and \"Emmylou\" for the Polar Music Prize winner [[Emmylou Harris]] in the TV broadcast gala at Stockholm, Sweden.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.musikindustrin.se/2015/05/25/polar-music-prize-kvinnliga-artister-hyllar-emmylou/|title= Polar Music Prize Kvinnliga artister hyllar Emmylou |date= 25 May 2015 |language=sv|publisher=musikindustrin.se|access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.polarmusicprize.org/laureates/emmylou-harris/|title= Emmylou Harris, Laureate of the Polar Music Prize 2015|publisher=polarmusicprize.org|access-date=28 May 2015}}</ref> They also performed covers songs by [[Bob Dylan]] and other folk singers on several Swedish TV programs.<ref>Multiple sources:\n*{{cite web|title=Del 8 av 12. \u00c5rets Nobelpristagare Bob Dylan analyseras och diskuteras p\u00e5 l\u00e4ngden och tv\u00e4ren (archived) |url=http://www.svtplay.se/video/10669135/babel/babel-sasong-24-avsnitt-8?info=visa#titel |access-date=15 October 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161019005315/http://www.svtplay.se/video/10669135/babel/babel-sasong-24-avsnitt-8?info=visa |archive-date=19 October 2016}}\n*{{cite web|title=B\u00e4sta \u00f6ppningen p\u00e5 Aktuellt n\u00e5gonsin? Se First Aid Kit-Klara S\u00f6derberg tolka Bob Dylans The Times They Are a-Changin (archived) |url=http://www.svtplay.se/klipp/10639926/basta-oppningen-pa-aktuellt-nagonsin-se-first-aid-kit-klara-soderberg-tolka-bob-dylans-the-times-they-are-a-changin |access-date=15 October 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161016041110/https://www.svtplay.se/klipp/10639926/basta-oppningen-pa-aktuellt-nagonsin-se-first-aid-kit-klara-soderberg-tolka-bob-dylans-the-times-they-are-a-changin |archive-date=16 October 2016}}\n*{{cite web|url = http://www.sydsvenskan.se/2016-11-05/first-aid-kit-till-kanal-5s-valvaka|title= First Aid Kit till Kanal 5:s valvaka|date= 5 November 2016|publisher=Sydsvenskan|access-date=10 November 2016}}\n*{{cite web|title=P\u00e5 sp\u00e5ret, S\u00e4song 27 - Avsnitt 1 (archived) |url=http://www.svtplay.se/video/11335746/pa-sparet/pa-sparet-sasong-27-avsnitt-1?info=visa#titel |access-date=15 October 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220182521/https://www.svtplay.se/video/11335746/pa-sparet/pa-sparet-sasong-27-avsnitt-1?info=visa |archive-date=20 December 2016}}</ref>\n\nThe duo sing harmonies on six tracks of [[Conor Oberst]]'s album ''[[Upside Down Mountain]]'' released on 20 May 2014.<ref name=\"Upside Down Mountain\">{{cite web|title=Rolling Stone Online 31 January 2014: Conor Oberst's New Morning: Bright Eyes Hits Nashville for Solo LP|date=31 January 2014 |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/conor-obersts-new-morning-bright-eyes-hits-nashville-for-solo-lp-20140131|publisher=Rollingstone.com|access-date=6 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|publisher=Pitchfork.com|url=http://pitchfork.com/news/53917-conor-oberst-announces-new-album-upside-down-mountain-and-tour-shares-hundreds-of-ways/|date=11 February 2014|title=Conor Oberst announces new album ''Upside Down Mountain'' and tour}}</ref> The duo sang backing vocals on five songs of Conor Oberst's set at [[Haldern Pop]] Festival in Germany on 9 August.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.intro.de/popmusik/so-war-das-haldern-pop-festival-2014|title=So war das Haldern Pop-Festival 2014|date=10 August 2014|publisher=intro.de|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=7 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171207020056/http://www.intro.de/popmusik/so-war-das-haldern-pop-festival-2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> They also contributed vocals to the title track of [[Jenny Lewis]]'s album ''[[The Voyager (Jenny Lewis album)|The Voyager]]'', released on 29 July 2014.<ref name=\"The Voyager\">{{cite web|title=First Listen: Jenny Lewis, The Voyager|website=[[National Public Radio]] |url=https://www.npr.org/2014/07/20/331347295/first-listen-jenny-lewis-the-voyager|publisher=npr.org|access-date=23 October 2014}}</ref> On 28 November 2014, First Aid Kit's 10\" vinyl single \"[[America (First Aid Kit's Single)|America]]\" was released as a [[Black Friday (shopping)|Black Friday]] record store day release.<ref>{{cite web|title=America \u2013 First Aid Kit|url=http://www.recordstoreday.com/SpecialRelease/7590|publisher=Recordstoreday.com|access-date=15 November 2014}}</ref> They sang backing vocals on [[Van William]]'s single \"Revolution\", released on 7 September 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.stereogum.com/1897549/van-william-revolution-feat-first-aid-kit/mp3s/|title= Van William \u2013 \"Revolution\" (Feat. First Aid Kit)|work=Stereogum|date= 7 September 2016|access-date=11 September 2016}}</ref> The song was subsequently included on Van William's album ''Countries'', released in January 2018, and peaked at number six on the US AAA chart.<ref name=\"Van William Countries\"/><ref name=\"Triple A\"/>\n\nAt the end of October 2014, it was announced that First Aid Kit's cover of [[R.E.M.]]'s \"Walk Unafraid\" would be included on the soundtrack of the movie ''[[Wild (2014 film)|Wild]]''.<ref name=\"WildSoundtrack\">{{cite web|title=Wild soundtrack|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/wild-original-motion-picture/id930345999/|publisher=iTunes|access-date=23 October 2014}}</ref> Moreover, their song \"Frozen Lake\" appeared in the Swedish film ''Min S\u00e5 Kallade Pappa''.<ref name=\"PappaFilm\">{{cite web|title=Ny First Aid Kit-l\u00e5t i Malmros film (17 September 2014)|url=http://www.gp.se/kulturnoje/1.2492651-ny-first-aid-kit-lat-i-malmros-film/|publisher=G\u00f6teborgs-Posten|access-date=23 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171029013303/http://www.gp.se/n%C3%B6je/ny-first-aid-kit-l%C3%A5t-i-malmros-film-1.236526|archive-date=29 October 2017|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\n===2017: Singles and resumed touring===\nAt the beginning of 2017 Klara and Johanna were at [[Flora Recording & Playback]] in Portland, Oregon, finishing their fourth album.\n\nIn early 2017, First Aid Kit provided backing vocals for Jesper Lindell's ''A Little Less Blue'' EP, which was produced by Sten Booberg and the duo's father, Benkt S\u00f6derberg.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://bloggar.aftonbladet.se/musikbloggen/2017/02/first-aid-kit-jesper-lindell-moving-slow/|title= First Aid Kit om Jesper Lindell: '\u00d6nskar vi skrivit l\u00e5ten!'|date= 10 February 2017|publisher=Aftonbladet|access-date=21 February 2017}}</ref> The EP was released on 21 April 2017.<ref name=\"A Little Less Blue\">{{cite web|url = https://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/bmg-scandinavia/pressreleases/first-aid-kit-gaestar-paa-jesper-lindells-efterlaengtade-debut-ep-1881544|title= First Aid Kit g\u00e4star p\u00e5 Jesper Lindells efterl\u00e4ngtade debut-EP!|date= 28 March 2017|publisher=BMG Scandinavia|access-date=4 April 2017}}</ref>\n\n[[File:First Aid Kit - Leonard Cohen tribute Concert - Dramaten Stockholm March 13 2017.jpg|thumb|First Aid Kit at their Leonard Cohen tribute concert in Dramaten, Stockholm, Sweden 13 March 2017]]\n\nOn 10 March, First Aid Kit released a new single, \"You Are the Problem Here\", for [[International Woman's Day]]. The band called the song an angry song, inspired by yet another story of a man getting off easy after raping a woman. The track was produced and mixed by Tucker Martine from [[Flora Recording & Playback]] studio.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.out.com/music/2017/3/08/first-aid-kits-you-are-problem-here-rips-apart-rape-apologists|title= First Aid Kit's 'You Are the Problem Here' Rips Apart Rape Apologists|date= 8 March 2017|publisher=Out Magazine|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/hear-first-aid-kits-vengeful-new-song-you-are-the-problem-here-w471010|title= Hear First Aid Kit's 'Vengeful' New Song 'You Are the Problem Here'|date= 8 March 2017|publisher=Rolling Stone|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=exsaCN4c5dc|title= First Aid Kit - You Are The Problem Here (Lyric Video)|date= 11 March 2017|publisher=Jagadambarecords|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref> A 7-inch vinyl copy of \"You Are the Problem Here\" was released on [[Record Store Day]] 2018. All profits from the song are donated to [[Women for Women International]].<ref>{{cite web|url = https://recordstoreday.com/SpecialRelease/10155|title= First Aid Kit - You are the problem here|work=recordstoreday.com|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.longlivevinyl.net/first-aid-kit-to-release-you-are-the-problem-here-7-for-record-store-day/|title= First Aid Kit to release You Are The Problem Here 7\" for Record Store Day|work=longlivevinyl.net|date= 8 March 2018|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit held four [[Leonard Cohen]]-themed concerts in Spring 2017 with their friends in [[Royal Dramatic Theatre|Dramaten]], Stockholm, Sweden.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://bloggar.aftonbladet.se/musikbloggen/2017/03/first-aid-kit-gor-suveran-cohen-hyllning/|title= First Aid Kit g\u00f6r suver\u00e4n Cohen-hyllning|date= 14 March 2017|publisher=Aftonbladet|access-date=15 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.dramaten.se/repertoar/First-aid-kit-leonard-cohen/|title= First Aid Kit och v\u00e4nner: en hyllning till Leonard Cohen|publisher=Dramaten|access-date=27 April 2017}}</ref> Their concert on 13 March was filmed by [[Sveriges Television]], and broadcast on 14 and 15 October by SVT2.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://vipatv.svt.se/204/kronikor/arkiv-for-kronikor/2017-03-17-alla-i-sverige-far-hora-first-aid-kit---tack-vare-svt.html|title= Alla i Sverige f\u00e5r h\u00f6ra First Aid Kit - tack vare SVT|publisher=SVT|access-date=18 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.svtplay.se/first-aid-kit-tolkar-cohen-pa-dramaten|title= First Aid Kit tolkar Cohen p\u00e5 Dramaten|publisher=SVT|access-date=15 October 2017}}</ref> An audio recording of the concert was released on 26 March 2021.<ref name=\"WhoByFire_NME\">{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/en_asia/news/music/first-aid-kit-announce-live-leonard-cohen-tribute-album-share-version-of-suzanne-2890697 |title= First Aid Kit announce live Leonard Cohen tribute album, share version of 'Suzanne' |publisher=NME|date=27 February 2021|access-date=2 March 2021}}</ref>\n\nOn Record Store Day 2017, [[Third Man Records]] published the book ''The Blue Series: The Story Behind the Color'', which contains a story by Johanna and Klara about recording songs in [[Jack White]]'s studio, and a 7-inch split blue vinyl single with the band's previously unreleased cover of \"[[Gloomy Sunday]]\". The record store day issue was limited to 500 copies. A regular release on black vinyl single was released on 6 June.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://thirdmanrecords.com/news/record-store-day-2017/|title=Record Store Day 2017|publisher=Third Man Records|access-date=28 April 2017|archive-date=27 April 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170427092050/https://thirdmanrecords.com/news/record-store-day-2017/|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nJohanna and Klara sang several songs with [[H\u00e5kan Hellstr\u00f6m]] at concerts on 9 and 10 June at [[Stockholm Olympic Stadium]], and on 28 and 29 July at [[Ullevi]] stadium in Gothenburg. On 25 August, H\u00e5kan Hellstr\u00f6m published a live recording of \"Du Fria\" in digital format.<ref name=\"Du Fria\">{{cite web|url = http://www.festivalrykten.se/hakan-hellstrom-slapper-livelat-med-silvana-imam-och-first-aid-kit/|title= H\u00e5kan Hellstr\u00f6m sl\u00e4pper livel\u00e5t med Silvana Iman och First Aid Kit|publisher=Festivalrykten|access-date=25 August 2017}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit resumed touring in Summer 2017, beginning with a concert on 16 June in [[Borgholm, Sweden]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gaffa.se/recension/118611/det-enda-som-saknas-aer-publiken-fran-woodstock|title=First Aid Kit, Borgholms Slottsruin, Borgholm|publisher=Gaffa|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206140020/http://gaffa.se/recension/118611/det-enda-som-saknas-aer-publiken-fran-woodstock|url-status=dead}}</ref> BBC broadcast their performance at Glastonbury Festival on 23 June,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/events/ec584f/acts/a6hxp6|title= First Aid Kit at Glastonbury 2017|publisher=BBC|access-date=6 July 2017}}</ref> during which they performed two songs from their upcoming album [[Ruins (First Aid Kit album)|''Ruins'']]: \"Fireworks\" and \"It's a Shame\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/09/first-aid-kit-new-single-its-a-shame.html|title=First Aid Kit Share Thoughtful New Single, \"It's A Shame\"|publisher=Paste Magazine|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206135817/https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/09/first-aid-kit-new-single-its-a-shame.html|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nDuring Fall 2017, the band gave several interviews in the UK and European media, including the German late night show ''Inas Nacht'' (''Ina's Night''), BBC Radio, Channel 4 TV news and the Channel 4 ''[[Sunday Brunch]]'' TV programme.<ref>Multiple sources:\n*{{cite web|url=http://www.daserste.de/unterhaltung/talk/inas-nacht/sendung/late-night-show-folge-19-100.html|title=Late-Night-Show - Folge 19|publisher=Das Erste|access-date=5 December 2017}}\n*{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b09dwcbw|title=First Aid Kit in Session - Jo Whiley BBC Radio 2|publisher=BBC|access-date=5 December 2017}}\n*{{cite web|url=https://www.channel4.com/news/topic/first-aid-kit|title=First Aid Kit interviewed|publisher=Channel 4|access-date=5 December 2017}}\n*{{cite web|url=http://www.radiotimes.com/tv-programme/e/fywm97/sunday-brunch--series-6-episode-38/|title=Sunday Brunch Series 6, Episode 38|publisher=radiotimes.com|access-date=5 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206140011/http://www.radiotimes.com/tv-programme/e/fywm97/sunday-brunch--series-6-episode-38/|url-status=dead}}\n*{{cite web|url=https://radio1.be/intieme-sessie-van-first-aid-kit|title=Intieme sessie van First Aid Kit|publisher=Radio1|access-date=5 December 2017}}</ref> Their performances of \"[[Perfect Places]]\" and \"[[Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas]]\" were released as \"Live From BBC Radio 2\" singles in digital format on 18 December 2017.<ref name=\"BBCLive2\">{{cite web|url = https://www.stereogum.com/1976165/hear-first-aid-kit-cover-lordes-perfect-places-have-yourself-a-merry-little-christmas-for-bbc-radio-2/music/|title=Hear First Aid Kit Cover Lorde's \"Perfect Places\" & \"Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas\" For BBC Radio 2|work=Stereogum|date=18 December 2017 |access-date=18 December 2017}}</ref>\n\n===2018\u20132019: ''Ruins''===\nOn 12 January 2018, First Aid Kit performed \"It's a Shame\" on BBC's ''[[Graham Norton Show]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b09m6320/the-graham-norton-show-series-22-episode-13|title=The Graham Norton Show Series 22 Episode 13|work=BBC|access-date=17 January 2018}}</ref> Johanna and Klara were also interviewed on the Norwegian-Swedish TV show ''[[Skavlan]]'', where they performed \"Fireworks\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.svtplay.se/video/16581450/skavlan/skavlan-sasong-19-avsnitt-1|title=Skavlan S\u00e4song 19 - Lars Lerin och First Aid Kit bland g\u00e4sterna|work=SVT|date=12 January 2018|access-date=17 January 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180118012047/https://www.svtplay.se/video/16581450/skavlan/skavlan-sasong-19-avsnitt-1|archive-date=18 January 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\n[[File:First Aid Kit - Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota (28224447409).jpg|thumb|Johanna, Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota, 2018]]\n[[File:First Aid Kit - Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota (28224428209).jpg|thumb|Klara, Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota, 2018]]\nThe album [[Ruins (First Aid Kit album)|''Ruins'']] was released on 19 January 2018. The album was recorded at [[Flora Recording & Playback]] in Portland, Oregon,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.instagram.com/p/BPVn9C0FJ4q/|title= Portland, Oregon|publisher=First Aid Kit, Instagram|access-date=21 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.lira.se/first-aid-kit-i-startgroparna/|title=First Aid Kit i startgroparna|date=23 January 2017 |publisher=Lira Musikmagasin|access-date=21 February 2017}}</ref> and contained 10 new songs.<ref name=\"Ruins\">{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/first-aid-kit-announce-new-album-ruins-share-new-song-postcard-listen/|title=First Aid Kit Announce New Album Ruins, Share New Song 'Postcard': Listen|work=Pitchfork|last=Wicks|first=Amanda|date=27 January 2017|access-date=28 October 2017}}</ref> The album was certified Gold in Sweden in August, and Silver in the UK in November.<ref name=\"sverigetopplistan.se\"/><ref name=\"bpi\"/> The release was followed by a tour throughout Canada, the US, Europe and Australia,<ref name=\"Columbia2017\">{{cite web|url=http://www.columbiarecords.com/news/1149|title=First Aid Kit to release new album Ruins - New Song \"Postcard\" Out Today - Tour Dates|publisher=Columbia Records|access-date=5 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206140055/http://www.columbiarecords.com/news/1149|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://consequence.net/2018/05/first-aid-kit-2018-tour/|title=First Aid Kit announce North American fall tour|work=Consequence|date=8 May 2018|access-date=2 February 2022}}</ref> including performances at [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival|Coachella]] on 14 and 21 April 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.laweekly.com/music/coachella-2018-haim-first-aid-kit-9370294|title=Coachella 2018: Haim, First Aid Kit|work=laweekly.com|date=16 April 2018|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.buzzmag.co.uk/features/being-quiet-isnt-an-option-first-aid-kit-interview/|title= \"Being quiet isn't an option\" \u2013 FIRST AID KIT INTERVIEW |work=buzzmag.co.uk|date=22 October 2018|access-date=15 December 2018}}</ref> During this period, they also performed on several radio and TV programs such as ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url = https://consequence.net/2018/01/first-aid-kit-perform-its-a-shame-on-ellen-watch/|title=First Aid Kit perform \"It's a Shame\" on Ellen|work=Consequence|date=23 January 2018|access-date=2 February 2022}}</ref> ''[[The Andrew Marr Show]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url = https://subsaga.com/bbc/news/the-andrew-marr-show/2018/03/04.html|title=04/03/2018 The Andrew Marr Show|work=subsaga.com|access-date=14 March 2018}}</ref> ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]''<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/first-aid-kit-bring-angelic-harmonies-to-kimmel-with-new-song-fireworks-628614/|title=First Aid Kit Bring Angelic Harmonies to 'Kimmel' With New Song, 'Fireworks'|work=rollingstone.com|date=13 April 2018|access-date=12 October 2018}}</ref> and ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]].<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/late-show-with-stephen-colbert/episode-200-season-3/jason-bateman-john-heilemann-alex-wagner-first-aid-kit/756671/|title= Late Show With Stephen Colbert, Season 3, Episode 200 John Heilemann & Alex Wagner; Judy Greer; First Aid Kit|work=tvguide.com|access-date=14 September 2018}}</ref>'' The songs on Ruins album are related with Klara's breakup with her boyfriend, but performing the songs on tour was hard for Johanna too as she had broken up with her boyfriend in January 2018 shortly after the album release.<ref name=\"WhoByFire-Independent2021\">{{cite web|url = https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/features/first-aid-kit-interview-who-by-fire-album-b1821193.html |title=First Aid Kit: 'We're not these innocent sisters holding hands \u2013 we're angry feminist bitches |work=independent.co.uk|date=24 March 2021|accessdate=30 September 2022}}</ref>\n\nOn 11 July, [[Spotify]] released a stripped-down version of \"Fireworks\" and a cover of [[Kate Bush]]'s song \"[[Running Up That Hill]]\" as singles that were recorded in the new Spotify studio in Stockholm.<ref name=\"Spotify2019\">{{cite web|url = https://newsroom.spotify.com/2018-07-12/the-otherworldly-magic-behind-first-aid-kits-new-spotify-singles/|title= The 'Otherworldly Magic' Behind First Aid Kit's New Spotify Singles|work=spotify.com|date=12 July 2018|access-date=13 July 2018}}</ref> On 14 September, the vinyl EP ''Tender Offerings'' was released, containing four previously unreleased tracks.<ref name=\"Tender Offerings EP\">{{cite web|url = https://www.amazon.com/Tender-Offerings-First-Aid-Kit/dp/B07F7R8KZC|title= Tender Offerings|work=amazon.com|access-date=25 August 2018}}</ref> The EP reached number one on the UK vinyl charts.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.officialcharts.com/charts/vinyl-singles-chart/|title=  Official Vinyl Singles Chart Top 40, 21 September 2018 - 27 September 2018 |website= [[OfficialCharts.com]] |access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit sang backing vocals on several 2018 releases, including [[Alela Diane]]'s song ''Ether & Wood'' from the album Cusp,<ref name=\"Cusp\"/> [[George Ezra]]'s song \"Saviour\" from the album ''[[Staying at Tamara's]],''<ref name=\"Ezra Saviour\">{{cite web|url = http://diymag.com/2018/03/13/george-ezra-first-aid-kit-saviour-staying-at-tamaras-watch|title= George Ezra recruits First Aid Kit for new track 'Saviour' |work=diymag.com|date=13 March 2018|access-date=11 October 2018}}</ref> and on [[Little Jinder]]'s song ''Goldwing'' from the album ''Hejd\u00e5''.<ref name=\"Jinder Goldwing\">{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/musik/a/VR8mn1/little-jinder-blandar-stark-elektronisk-haxgrogg|title= Little Jinder blandar stark elektronisk h\u00e4xgrogg |work=aftonbladet.se|date=5 October 2018|access-date=11 October 2018}}</ref>\n\nIn November 2018, ''Ruins'' was nominated for International Album of the Year at the 2019 UK Americana Awards.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/ef-country/uk-americana-awards-2019-nominations-revealed/|title=  UK Americana Awards 2019 nominations revealed |work=entertainment-focus.com|date= 8 November 2018 |access-date=15 December 2018}}</ref> The band also received two Swedish Grammis award nominations in 2019, one for Song of the Year for ''\"''Fireworks,\" and another for Alternative Pop Album of the Year for ''Ruins''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://grammis.se/nominated_year/2019/|title=Grammis nominated 2019|work=grammis.se|access-date=15 December 2018|archive-date=17 October 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201017140433/https://grammis.se/nominated_year/2019/|url-status=dead}}</ref> In January 2019, they were again nominated for the International Group Brit Award.<ref name=\"Brit2019\"/>\n\nThe duo's song \"Home Again\" appeared  on the soundtrack for the TV show [[Moominvalley]],<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.moomin.com/en/blog/the-star-studded-lineup-for-the-moominvalley-tv-series-soundtrack-finally-revealed-tom-odell-mo-first-aid-kit-and-alma-featured/|title= The star-studded lineup for the Moominvalley TV series soundtrack finally revealed \u2013 Tom Odell, M\u00d8, First Aid Kit and Alma featured |work=moomin.com|date=25 January 2019|access-date=27 January 2019}}</ref> which was released on 19 April.<ref name=\"Moominvalley\">{{cite web|url = https://www.gutsy.fi/post/columbia-records-in-partnership-with-gutsy-animations-to-release-moominvalley-soundtrack |title= Columbia Records in partnership with Gutsy Animations to release Moominvalley soundtrack |work=gutsy.fi|date=22 February 2019|access-date=12 May 2019}}</ref>\n\nOn May 18 2019, the duo canceled all planned 2019 summer dates due to unforeseen medical circumstances.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/news/music/first-aid-kit-cancel-summer-tour-dates-due-unforeseen-medical-circumstances-2489741 |title= First Aid Kit cancel all summer tour dates due to \"unforeseen medical circumstances\" |work=nme.com|date=19 May 2019|access-date=19 May 2019}}</ref> It was later revealed that the concerts were canceled because Klara was experiencing burnout.<ref name=\"Kristianstadsbladet2019\">{{cite web|url = http://www.kristianstadsbladet.se/nyheter/first-aid-kit-kravs-mod-att-tacka-nej/ |title= First Aid Kit: \"Kr\u00e4vs mod att tacka nej\" |work=kristianstadsbladet.se|date=13 December 2019|access-date=26 December 2019}}</ref><ref name=\"Femina2020\">{{cite web|url = https://www.femina.se/intervju/first-aid-kit-klara-om-utbrandheten-allt-kraschade-jag-kom-inte-ur-sangen/3264800 |title= First Aid Kit-Klara om utbr\u00e4ndheten: \"Allt kraschade, jag kom inte ur s\u00e4ngen\" |work=Femina|date=25 September 2020|access-date=24 November 2020}}</ref>\n\nKlara wrote \"Strange Beauty\" after the suicide of [[David Berman (musician)|David Berman]]. The track was published on August 22, along with their cover of ''\"''Random Rules\" by Berman's band [[Silver Jews]].<ref name=\"BermanCovers\">{{cite web|url = http://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/sonybmg/pressreleases/first-aid-kit-slaepper-tvaa-laatar-som-en-hyllning-till-silver-jews-nyligen-avlidne-frontman-david-berman-2908656 |title= First Aid Kit sl\u00e4pper tv\u00e5 l\u00e5tar som en hyllning till Silver Jews nyligen avlidne frontman David Berman |work=sonybmg|date=22 August 2019|access-date=22 August 2019}}</ref>\n\nOn 16 October 2019, the duo received the [[Ulla Billquist]] scholarship, which is awarded each year to female artists who enrich the Swedish music scene through their artistry.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.folketshusochparker.se/first-aid-kit-ar-2019-ars-ulla-billquist-stipendiat/ |title= First aid kit \u00e4r 2019 \u00e5rs Ulla Billquist stipendiat |work= Folkets Hus och Parker |date=16 October 2019|access-date=17 October 2019}}</ref>\n\nOn 11 December, First Aid Kit played three songs at the Swedish TV's charity program [[Musikhj\u00e4lpen]] with [[Maja Francis]].<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.svt.se/nyheter/lokalt/vastmanland/har-hyllar-first-aid-kit-artisten-marie-fredriksson-live-i-musikhjalpen |title= H\u00e4r hyllar First Aid Kit artisten Marie Fredriksson live i Musikhj\u00e4lpen |newspaper= SVT Nyheter |date=11 December 2019|access-date=12 December 2019|last1=Gustavsson |first1=Robert }}</ref> First Aid Kit had Christmas-themed shows on December 17, 18 and 19 in Stockholm with [[Amanda Bergman]] and Maja Francis. <ref>{{cite web |url= https://sodrateatern.com/winter-is-blue/ |title= Winter is Blue - Julkonsert med First Aid Kit, Maja Francis och Amanda Bergman |work= Sodra Teatern |access-date= 25 October 2019 |archive-date= 25 October 2019 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20191025143916/https://sodrateatern.com/winter-is-blue/ |url-status= dead }}</ref><ref name=\"Kristianstadsbladet2019\" /><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/musik/a/vQpQMX/stamsangen-plogar-bort-allt-motstand |title= St\u00e4ms\u00e5ngen plogar bort allt motst\u00e5nd - Julkonserten med First Aid Kit \u00e4r magisk |work=aftonbladet.se|date=18 December 2019|access-date=26 December 2019}}</ref>\n\n===2020\u20132021: Streams, covers and collaborations during COVID-19 pandemic===\n\nOn 13 January 2020, Johanna announced that she is expecting a baby in the summer<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/8m1ew1/first-aid-kit-sangerskan-ar-gravid |title= First aid kit-s\u00e5ngerskan \u00e4r gravid |work=aftonbladet.se|date=13 January 2020|access-date=14 January 2020}}</ref> A baby girl was born on 18 June.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/LAJ5Kp/first-aid-kit-stjarnan-har-fatt-barn |title= First aid kit-stj\u00e4rnan har f\u00e5tt barn |work=Aftonbladet|date=23 June 2020|access-date=23 June 2020}}</ref> On 16 January, Klara announced that she will start a country club in Stockholm with a house band.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.cafe.se/first-aid-kit-klara-och-sverrir-gudnason-startar-countryklubb-i-stockholm/ |title= First Aid Kit-Klara och Sverrir Gudnason startar countryklubb i Stockholm |work=cafe.se|date=16 January 2020|access-date=20 January 2020}}</ref> The first event was held on 21 February, right before the concert venues were closed due to the pandemic.<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/lyckad-start-for-klara-soderbergs-egna-countryklubb/ |title= Lyckad start f\u00f6r Klara S\u00f6derbergs countryklubb |work=Dagens Nyheter|date=22 February 2020|access-date=25 February 2020}}</ref> During spring 2020 [[COVID-19 lockdowns]] the band streamed live concerts from Johanna's home.\n\nOn 14 August 2020, First Aid Kit released a cover version of [[Willie Nelson]]'s song \"[[On the Road Again (Willie Nelson song)|On the Road Again]]\". Proceeds from the song were donated to Crew Nation, to support crew members who were forced out of work due to [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref name=\"OnTheRoadAgain\">{{cite web|url = https://www.spin.com/2020/08/first-aid-kit-willie-nelson-on-the-road-again-cover/ |title= First Aid Kit Share Cover of Willie Nelson's 'On the Road Again' |work=spin.com|date=14 August 2020|access-date=25 August 2020}}</ref> On 25 September, they released two cover versions of [[Ted G\u00e4rdestad]]'s \"Come Give Me Love\", one sung with the original Swedish lyrics, and the other with their own translation of the lyrics into English.<ref name=\"ComeGiveMeLove\">{{cite web|url = https://www.thelineofbestfit.com/news/latest-news/first-aid-kit-unveil-cover-of-ted-gaerdestads-come-give-me-love |title= First Aid Kit unveil cover of Ted G\u00e4rdestad's \"Come Give Me Love\" |work=thelineofbestfit.com|date=25 September 2020|access-date=26 September 2020}}</ref><ref name=\"Femina2020\"/> In 2021 the band performed on some Swedish TV-programs.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tv4play.se/program/en-kv%C3%A4ll-f%C3%B6r-musiksverige-dont-stop-the-music|title=En kv\u00e4ll f\u00f6r musiksverige - Don't Stop the Music|work=tv4play.se|date=30 January 2021|access-date=13 February 2021|archive-date=1 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210201061625/https://www.tv4play.se/program/en-kv%C3%A4ll-f%C3%B6r-musiksverige-dont-stop-the-music|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/395lbM/en-salladskal-avgjorde-pa-sparet-semifinalen |title= En salladsk\u00e5l avgjorde \"P\u00e5 sp\u00e5ret\"-semifinalen |work=aftonbladet|date=8 February 2021|access-date=13 February 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/vAww05/andra-semifinalen-blev-en-rafflande-historia |title= Andra semifinalen blev en rafflande historia |work=aftonbladet|date=12 February 2021|access-date=13 February 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/news/music/first-aid-kit-cover-bette-midlers-the-rose-on-swedish-game-show-2884987 |title= First Aid Kit cover Bette Midler's 'The Rose' on Swedish game show |work=NME|date=20 February 2021|access-date=21 February 2021}}</ref>\n\n''Suzanne'' single from the ''Who by Fire'' live album recorded in 2017 at the [[Leonard Cohen]] tribute concert was released in February 2021 and the full album on 26 March 2021.<ref name=\"WhoByFire_NME\"/><ref name=\"WhoByFire-Independent2021\"/>\n\nFirst Aid Kit appear as the Treetaur Shamans named Big Tree (voiced by Johanna) and Little Tree (voiced by Klara) in both the original English version and Swedish dub of Season 1 Episode 4 of the Netflix series [[Centaurworld]].<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.playbill.com/article/centaurworld-stars-megan-hilty-jessie-mueller-and-kimiko-glenn-talk-about-shooting-mini-centaurs-from-their-hooves |title= Centaurworld Stars Megan Hilty, Jessie Mueller, and Kimiko Glenn Talk About Shooting Mini Centaurs From Their Hooves |work=playbill.com|date=2 August 2021|access-date=3 August 2021}}</ref> They reprised their roles in Season 2.\n\nFirst Aid Kit appear on [[Thomas Stenstr\u00f6m]]'s song ''\"''Hotel Amigo\" on his album ''Spring Baby Spring'', released on 17 September 2021;<ref>{{cite news|url = https://sverigesradio.se/artikel/thomas-stenstroms-nya-lat-en-hyllning-till-emmaboda-hotellet |title= Thomas Stenstr\u00f6ms nya l\u00e5t \u2013 en hyllning till Emmaboda-hotellet |work=sverigesradio.se|date=10 September 2021|access-date=16 September 2021|last1= Bj\u00f6re |first1= Rasmus |last2= Blomberg |first2= Viktor }}</ref><ref name=\"Springbaby\">{{cite news|url = https://sverigesradio.se/artikel/recension-thomas-stenstroms-album-spring-baby-spring |title= Recension: Thomas Stenstr\u00f6ms album Spring baby, spring |work=sverigesradio.se|date=17 September 2021|access-date=20 September 2021|last1= Rosenstr\u00f6m |first1= Anna }}</ref> [[Maja Francis]]' song ''\"''Mama\" on her album ''A Pink Soft Mess'' released on 24 September 2021;<ref name=\"FrancisMama\">{{cite web|url = https://www.orebronyheter.com/maja-francis-slapper-debutalbumet-a-pink-soft-mess/ |title= Maja Francis sl\u00e4pper debutalbumet \"A Pink Soft Mess\" |work=orebronyheter.com|date=17 September 2021|access-date=24 September 2021}}</ref> and on [[Joakim Th\u00e5str\u00f6m|Th\u00e5str\u00f6m]]'s single \"Isbergen\" released on 15 October 2021.<ref name=\"Isbergen\">{{cite web|url = https://482mhz.com/2021/10/15/recension-thastrom-isbergen/ |title= Recension: Th\u00e5str\u00f6m \u2013 \"Isbergen\" |work=482mhz.com|date=15 October 2021|access-date=25 October 2021}}</ref> The duo appear on Th\u00e5str\u00f6m's song \"S\u00f6dra Korset\" as well.<ref name=\"S\u00f6dra Korset\">{{cite web|url=https://gaffa.se/nyhet/152848/thastroem-intervjuas-och-spelar-i-tv-skivan-gaestas-av-first-aid-kit/|title=Th\u00e5str\u00f6m intervjuas och spelar i TV \u2013 skivan g\u00e4stas av First Aid Kit|work=gaffa.se|date=11 November 2021|access-date=16 November 2021|archive-date=16 November 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211116203419/https://gaffa.se/nyhet/152848/thastroem-intervjuas-och-spelar-i-tv-skivan-gaestas-av-first-aid-kit/|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\n===2022: ''Palomino'' and new backing band===\n\nOn 19 January 2022 First Aid Kit streamed Lion's Roar 10th anniversary concert from Mosebacke Etablissement, Stockholm with brothers Johannes and Gabriel Runemark who will be new band members.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sVnCgz-wwlA |title= First Aid Kit - The Lion's Roar 10th Anniversary Live Stream |work=First Aid Kit|date=19 January 2022|access-date=25 June 2022}}</ref>\n\nOn 8 March 2022 Swedish TV4 aired combined cooking and music program \u201dBenjamin's\u201d episode where Klara and Johanna were guests.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://nojeslivet.newsner.com/tv/first-aid-kits-arliga-ord-om-duetten-med-benjamin-efter-starka-erkannandet-i-tv4-att-vi-har/ |title= First Aid Kits \u00e4rliga ord om duetten med Benjamin Ingrosso \u2013 efter starka erk\u00e4nnandet i TV4 |work=N\u00f6jeslivet|date=9 March 2022|access-date=25 June 2022}}</ref> The Swedish version of Come Give Me Love performed with [[Benjamin Ingrosso]] in the show was released as a single in various streaming services.<ref name=\"ComeGiveMeLove-Apple\">{{cite web|url = https://music.apple.com/us/album/come-give-me-love-live-at-benjamins-single/1612644664 |title= Come Give Me Love (Live at Benjamin's) - Single |work=music.apple.com|date=8 March 2022|access-date=5 August 2022}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit started touring in June 2022 and released the first single ''Angel'' from their fifth album ''[[Palomino (First Aid Kit album)|Palomino]]''.<ref name=\"Angel NME\">{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/news/music/first-aid-kit-return-after-three-years-with-brand-new-single-angel-3253508 |title= First Aid Kit return after three years with brand new single 'Angel' |work=nme.com|date=22 June 2022|access-date=25 June 2022}}</ref><ref name=\"Palomino_Lineofbestfit\">{{cite web|url = https://www.thelineofbestfit.com/news/latest-news/first-aid-kit-announce-fifth-album-palomino |title= First Aid Kit announce fifth album Palomino |work=thelineofbestfit.com|date=8 August 2022|access-date=9 August 2022}}</ref> They played [[Glastonbury]] on 24 June<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p0c7zw34|title= First Aid Kit Glastonbury 2022: The Swedish sisters charm the crowd with their invigorating folk music|website=BBC Music|date= 24 June 2022|accessdate=25 June 2022}}</ref> with Freja Drakenberg, Gabriel Runemark and Johannes Runemark. At the end of July they released a cover of [[Don Henley]]'s ''[[The Boys of Summer (song)|The Boys of Summer]]'' as a single in various streaming services.<ref name=\"BoysOfSummer-ourculture\">{{cite web|url = https://ourculturemag.com/2022/07/31/first-aid-kit-cover-don-henleys-the-boys-of-summer/ |title= First Aid Kit Cover Don Henley's 'The Boys of Summer' |work=ourculturemag.com|date=31 July 2022|access-date=5 August 2022}}</ref> Second single, ''Out of My Head'' from the album was released on 12 August, the third one ''Turning Onto You'', on 30 September.<ref name=\"TurningOntoYou_Undertheradar\">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/first_aid_kit_share_new_song_turning_onto_you |title= First Aid Kit Share New Song \"Turning Onto You\" |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=30 September 2022|access-date=1 October 2022}}</ref> and the fourth, ''A Feeling That Never Came'', on 20 October.<ref name=\"AFeelingThatNeverCame_Undertheradar\">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/first_aid_kit_share_new_single_a_feeling_that_never_came |title= First Aid Kit Share New Single \"A Feeling That Never Came\" |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=21 October 2022|access-date=22 October 2022}}</ref> ''Palomino'' was released on 4 November 2022.<ref name=\"Palomino_Lineofbestfit\"/><ref name=\"Palomino_Consequence\">{{cite web|url = https://consequence.net/video/first-aid-kit-interview-palomino/ |title= First Aid Kit on Sisterhood, 10th Anniversary of Lion's Roar and the Tonal Juxtaposition of Their New Album Palomino |work=consequence.net|date=3 November 2022|access-date=4 November 2022}}</ref><ref name=\"Palomino_Undertheradar\">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/reviews/palomino_first_aid_kit |title= Reviews First Aid Kit Palomino |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=3 November 2022|access-date=4 November 2022}}</ref> Extensive touring followed the album release.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://music.mxdwn.com/2022/11/06/news/first-aid-kit-announces-spring-summer-2023-tour-dates/ |title= First Aid Kit Announces Spring & Summer 2023 Tour Dates |work=music.mxdwn.com|date=6 November 2022|access-date=8 November 2022}}</ref> On 7 July 2023 deluxe edition of Palomino album was released with five new tracks added in streaming services and lyric video of ''Everybody's Got to Learn'' was published.<ref name=\"PalominoDeluxe\">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/first_aid_kit_stream_the_deluxe_edition_of_palomino_featuring_five_new_trac |title= First Aid Kit \u2013 Stream the Deluxe Edition of \"Palomino\" Featuring Five New Tracks |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=7 July 2023|access-date=27 September 2023}}</ref> \n\nOn 9 October 2023 Johanna announced that she is expecting her second baby.<ref>{{cite news|title=\"First aid kit\"-stj\u00e4rnan v\u00e4ntar sitt andra barn |newspaper=Aftonbladet |date=9 October 2023 |url=https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/APyvK3/johanna-soderberg-fran-first-aid-kit-vantar-sitt-andra-barn|publisher=aftonbladet.se|access-date=21 October 2023}}</ref> In spite of this, First Aid Kit had a tour in Scandinavia that started on 30 October from Gothenburg.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit \u00e5ker ut p\u00e5 turn\u00e9 |work=Gaffa |date=27 September 2023 |url=https://gaffa.se/nyheter/2023/september/first-aid-kit-aker-ut-pa-turne/|publisher=gaffa.se|access-date=21 October 2023}}</ref> A baby girl was born on 26 March 2024. The next live performances will be in Stockholm with Swedish Radio Symphony Orchestra on 30 January, 31 January and 1 February 2025.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit meets the Swedish Radio Symphony Orchestra |work=berwaldhallen.se |url=https://www.berwaldhallen.se/en/concert/first-aid-kit-meets-the-swedish-radio-symphony-orchestra/|access-date=29 May 2024}}</ref>\n\nOn 12 January 2023 First Aid Kit was nominated third time for the International Group of the Year Brit award.<ref name=\"Brit2023\"/> On 3 May 2023 First Aid Kit won Swedish Grammis award for Palomino in the 2023 alternative pop category.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.tv4play.se/klipp/3addc91c9c80184553fc?first=13343771 |title= First Aid Kit vinner pris f\u00f6r \"\u00c5rets alternativa pop\" p\u00e5 Grammisgalan 2023 |work=tv4pay.se|date=3 May 2023|access-date=27 September 2023}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit appear on [[Tove Lo]]'s song ''Cute & Cruel'' on her 14 October 2022 released album ''[[Dirt Femme]]'',<ref name=\"Cute&Cruel\">{{cite web|url = https://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/tove-lo-dirt-femme/ |title= ALBUMS Dirt Femme Tove Lo 2022 |work=Pitchfork|date=31 October 2022|access-date=17 February 2023}}</ref> on [[Pink (singer)|Pink]]'s song ''Kids in Love'' on her 17 February 2023 released album ''[[Trustfall]]'',<ref name=\"KidsInLove\">{{cite web|url = https://www.irishexaminer.com/lifestyle/artsandculture/arid-41073101.html |title= Album review: Pink enlists the help of First Aid Kit and Max Martin |work=Irish Examiner|date=17 February 2023|access-date=17 February 2023}}</ref> on [[M. Ward]]'s songs ''Too Young To Die'' and ''Engine 5'' on his ''Supernatural Thing'' album that was released on June 23<ref name=\"SupernaturalThing\">{{cite web|url = https://www.stereoboard.com/content/view/239385/9 |title= M. Ward Announces New Album 'Supernatural Thing', Shares Title Track |work=stereoboard.com|date=28 April 2023|access-date=3 May 2023}}</ref> and on [[Lola Kirke]]'s song ''All My Exes Live in L.A.'' that will be on her 16 February 2024 released EP ''Country Curious''.<ref name=\"Exes_LolaKirke\">{{cite web|url = https://www.msn.com/en-us/music/news/lola-kirke-ditches-her-former-flames-and-clothes-in-revealing-video-for-all-my-exes-live-in-la/ar-AA1fApaQ |title= Lola Kirke Ditches Her Former Flames (and Clothes) in Revealing Video for 'All My Exes Live in L.A.' |work=msn.com|date=22 August 2023|access-date=27 September 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Band members==\n\n===Line-up===\n*Klara S\u00f6derberg \u2013 vocals, guitar, keyboards (2007\u2013present)\n*Johanna S\u00f6derberg \u2013 vocals, bass guitar, keyboards, autoharp (2007\u2013present)\n*Freja \"Freja the Dragon\" Drakenberg \u2013 keyboards (2022\u2013present)\n*Scott Simpson \u2013 drums (2015\u20132019 and occasionally to present. He is also the band's long time tour manager)\n*Gabriel Runemark - drums (2022\u2013present)\n*Johannes Runemark (a.k.a. Kasino) \u2013 guitar and mandolin (2022\u2013present)\n\n===Previous members===\n*Mattias Bergqvist \u2013 drums (2009\u20132012)\n*Niclas Lindstr\u00f6m \u2013 drums (2012\u20132014)\n*Melvin Duffy \u2013 pedal steel guitar, mandolin and electric guitar (2013\u20132019)<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.theadvocate.com/baton_rouge/entertainment_life/article_92ddfb78-eea4-5eee-88cc-a76ea0a2dcfa.html|title=Swedish sisters bring sweet harmony to House of Blues|work=.theadvocate.com|date=15 November 2014|access-date=21 March 2018}}</ref>\n*Steve Moore \u2013 keyboards, trombone (2017\u20132019)\n\n==Discography==\n===Albums===\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|+ List of studio albums, with selected chart positions, sales figures and certifications\n! style=\"text-align:center;\" rowspan=\"2\"| Album \n|-\n! style=\"width:45px;\"|<small>[[Sverigetopplistan|SWE]]</small><br><ref name=\"SWE Singles\"/>\n|-\n| style=\"text-align:center;\" rowspan=\"8\"|2018\n|align=\"left\"|\"To Live a Life\"\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|64\n|\n|align=\"left\" rowspan=\"7\"|''Ruins''\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|\"Rebel Heart\"\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|65\n|\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|\"Distant Star\"\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|82\n|\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|\"Postcard\"\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|93\n|\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|\"My Wild Sweet Love\"\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|\u2014{{efn|group=upper-alpha|\"My Wild Sweet Love\" did not enter the Sverigetopplistan singles chart, but peaked at number four on the Sverigetopplistan Heatseeker chart.<ref name=\"SWEHeatseeker\">{{cite web|url=http://www.sverigetopplistan.se/netdata/ghl002.mbr/lista?liid=215&dfom=20180119|title=Veckolista Heatseeker \u2013 Vecka 4, 26 januar 2018|publisher=[[Sverigetopplistan]]|access-date=27 January 2018}}</ref>}}\n|\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|\"Hem of Her Dress\"\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|\u2014{{efn|group=upper-alpha|\"Hem of Her Dress\" did not enter the Sverigetopplistan singles chart, but peaked at number eight on the Sverigetopplistan Heatseeker chart.<ref name=\"SWEHeatseeker\"/>}}\n|\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|\"Nothing Has to Be True\"\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|\u2014{{efn|group=upper-alpha|\"Nothing Has to Be True\" did not enter the Sverigetopplistan singles chart, but peaked at number 12 on the Sverigetopplistan Heatseeker chart.<ref name=\"SWEHeatseeker\"/>}}\n|\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|\"Saviour\"<br/>{{small|[[George Ezra]] featuring First Aid Kit}}\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"|\u2014\n|\n* BPI: Silver<ref name=bpi/>\n| ''[[Staying at Tamara's]]''\n|}\n\n===Other guest appearances===\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| \"On the Road Again\"\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Come Give Me Love\"\n|-\n| rowspan=\"5\"| 2022\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Angel\"<ref name=\"Angel NME\"/>\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Out of My Head\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.stereogum.com/2196134/first-aid-kit-out-of-my-head-palomino/music/ |title=First Aid Kit \u2013 \"Out Of My Head\"|website=stereogum.com|date=12 August 2022|access-date=9 October 2022}}</ref>\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Turning Onto You\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/first_aid_kit_share_video_for_turning_onto_you |title=First Aid Kit Share Video For \"Turning Onto You\"|website=undertheradarmag.com|date=9 October 2022|access-date=9 October 2022}}</ref>\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| \"A Feeling That Never Came\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://music.mxdwn.com/2022/10/27/news/first-aid-kit-shares-new-lighthearted-music-video-for-a-feeling-that-never-came/ |title=First Aid Kit Shares New Lighthearted Music Video for \"A Feeling That Never Came\"|website=music.mxdwn.com|date=27 October 2022|access-date=8 November 2022}}</ref>\n|-\n!
